resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
assignUser commented on PR #14247:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14247#issuecomment-1259488553

   I will start a crossbow job manually and add the link once it is running.

raulcd commented on code in PR #14247:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14247#discussion_r981443050


##########
dev/tasks/docs/github.linux.yml:
##########
@@ -44,23 +44,18 @@ jobs:
           ref: {{ default_branch|default("master") }}
           path: crossbow
           fetch-depth: 1
-      - name: Move docs
+      - name: Prepare docs
         run: |
           # build files are created by the docker user
           sudo chown -R ${USER}: build
-          PR_DIR=crossbow/docs/pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}
-          mkdir -p $PR_DIR
-          rsync -a --delete build/docs/ $PR_DIR
-      - name: Push changes
+          # These are only used while generating the page
+          rm -rf build/docs/.doctrees
+      - name: Upload preview to S3
+        env: 
+          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: {{ '${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}' }}

Review Comment:
   I am probably missing something but wouldn't the following work?
   ```suggestion
             AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: ${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
   
   ```

assignUser commented on code in PR #14247:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14247#discussion_r981470126


##########
dev/tasks/docs/github.linux.yml:
##########
@@ -44,23 +44,18 @@ jobs:
           ref: {{ default_branch|default("master") }}
           path: crossbow
           fetch-depth: 1
-      - name: Move docs
+      - name: Prepare docs
         run: |
           # build files are created by the docker user
           sudo chown -R ${USER}: build
-          PR_DIR=crossbow/docs/pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}
-          mkdir -p $PR_DIR
-          rsync -a --delete build/docs/ $PR_DIR
-      - name: Push changes
+          # These are only used while generating the page
+          rm -rf build/docs/.doctrees
+      - name: Upload preview to S3
+        env: 
+          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: {{ '${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}' }}

Review Comment:
   No, the github "macro" `${{}}` needs to be wrapped in jinja `{{}}` otherwise jinja will complain that there is no var named secrets. It's a bit clunky but I don't know of a better way to prevent jinja from complaining.

pitrou commented on PR #14247:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14247#issuecomment-1259769589

   The generated link here seems broken, is it expected? https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions/runs/3136290102

raulcd commented on code in PR #14247:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14247#discussion_r981477858


##########
dev/tasks/docs/github.linux.yml:
##########
@@ -44,23 +44,18 @@ jobs:
           ref: {{ default_branch|default("master") }}
           path: crossbow
           fetch-depth: 1
-      - name: Move docs
+      - name: Prepare docs
         run: |
           # build files are created by the docker user
           sudo chown -R ${USER}: build
-          PR_DIR=crossbow/docs/pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}
-          mkdir -p $PR_DIR
-          rsync -a --delete build/docs/ $PR_DIR
-      - name: Push changes
+          # These are only used while generating the page
+          rm -rf build/docs/.doctrees
+      - name: Upload preview to S3
+        env: 
+          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: {{ '${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}' }}

Review Comment:
   I see, it is a way of escaping the `{{ }}` on Jinja. I suppose you could use the following tags? I haven't tested so I might be wrong but I understand why you are doing it now: https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/3.1.x/templates/#escaping
   ```
   {% raw %}
   {% endraw %}
   ```

pitrou commented on code in PR #14247:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14247#discussion_r982265717


##########
dev/tasks/docs/github.linux.yml:
##########
@@ -44,23 +44,18 @@ jobs:
           ref: {{ default_branch|default("master") }}
           path: crossbow
           fetch-depth: 1
-      - name: Move docs
+      - name: Prepare docs
         run: |
           # build files are created by the docker user
           sudo chown -R ${USER}: build
-          PR_DIR=crossbow/docs/pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}
-          mkdir -p $PR_DIR
-          rsync -a --delete build/docs/ $PR_DIR
-      - name: Push changes
+          # These are only used while generating the page
+          rm -rf build/docs/.doctrees
+      - name: Upload preview to S3
+        env: 
+          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: {{ '${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}' }}

Review Comment:
   @assignUser Do you want to try @raulcd's suggestion?



##########
dev/tasks/docs/github.linux.yml:
##########
@@ -44,23 +44,18 @@ jobs:
           ref: {{ default_branch|default("master") }}
           path: crossbow
           fetch-depth: 1
-      - name: Move docs
+      - name: Prepare docs
         run: |
           # build files are created by the docker user
           sudo chown -R ${USER}: build
-          PR_DIR=crossbow/docs/pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}
-          mkdir -p $PR_DIR
-          rsync -a --delete build/docs/ $PR_DIR
-      - name: Push changes
+          # These are only used while generating the page
+          rm -rf build/docs/.doctrees
+      - name: Upload preview to S3
+        env: 
+          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: {{ '${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}' }}
+          AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: {{ '${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}' }}
+          AWS_DEFAULT_REGION: us-east-2
+          BUCKET: s3://voltrondata-labs-crossbow-docs
         run: |
-          cd crossbow
-          git config --local user.name "Github Actions"
-          git config --local user.email "github-actions@users.noreply.github.com"
-          
-          URL_PATH=pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}
-          URL=https://crossbow.voltrondata.com/$URL_PATH
-
-          git add docs/$URL_PATH
-          git commit -m "Add docs preview for PR {{ pr_number }}"
-          git push
-          echo ":open_book: You can find the preview here: $URL" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
+          aws s3 cp build/docs/ $BUCKET/pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}/ --recursive

Review Comment:
   Or perhaps only `build/docs/html` needs to be uploaded?

assignUser commented on code in PR #14247:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14247#discussion_r982288082


##########
dev/tasks/docs/github.linux.yml:
##########
@@ -44,23 +44,18 @@ jobs:
           ref: {{ default_branch|default("master") }}
           path: crossbow
           fetch-depth: 1
-      - name: Move docs
+      - name: Prepare docs
         run: |
           # build files are created by the docker user
           sudo chown -R ${USER}: build
-          PR_DIR=crossbow/docs/pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}
-          mkdir -p $PR_DIR
-          rsync -a --delete build/docs/ $PR_DIR
-      - name: Push changes
+          # These are only used while generating the page
+          rm -rf build/docs/.doctrees
+      - name: Upload preview to S3
+        env: 
+          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: {{ '${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}' }}
+          AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: {{ '${{ secrets.CROSSBOW_DOCS_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}' }}
+          AWS_DEFAULT_REGION: us-east-2
+          BUCKET: s3://voltrondata-labs-crossbow-docs
         run: |
-          cd crossbow
-          git config --local user.name "Github Actions"
-          git config --local user.email "github-actions@users.noreply.github.com"
-          
-          URL_PATH=pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}
-          URL=https://crossbow.voltrondata.com/$URL_PATH
-
-          git add docs/$URL_PATH
-          git commit -m "Add docs preview for PR {{ pr_number }}"
-          git push
-          echo ":open_book: You can find the preview here: $URL" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
+          aws s3 cp build/docs/ $BUCKET/pr_docs/{{ pr_number }}/ --recursive

Review Comment:
   `build/docs` is the root folder for the generated site and does not contain a `html` folder. Everything in it is necessary for the page (except the `.docstrees` folder we delete in the step prior). You can check the example upload above.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Hosting on Github Pages as implemented in [ARROW-12958] is unsustainable due to the size of the arrow docs (~ 200mb).
